title: GARLIC SESAME SOBA NOODLES
directions: Bring a large pot of heavily salted water to a boil. Add soba noodles and cook according to package directions. Drain, rinse with cold water, and drain again.
Meanwhile, whisk agave, vinegar, soy sauce, and chili-garlic sauce in a small bowl. Set aside.

In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Saut√© mushrooms until soft and lightly browned. Add garlic and scallions and let cook a few more minutes until fragrant. Add the soy sauce mixture and let cook for 1 more minute until heated through.
In a large bowl, toss the soba noodles with the sauce, sesame oil, and sesame seeds. I prefer to eat these noodles chilled, but you could eat them hot or cold.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons chili-garlic sauce or 1 teaspoon red chili flakes
